issue_1_generate_deploy.symptom: Bash substitution error at line 61: ${{firstDay.location}}, ${{firstDay.date}}, etc
issue_1_generate_deploy.root_cause: Double brace {{ }} syntax in Python heredoc treated as bash variable substitution
issue_1_generate_deploy.root_cause_commit: Unknown - script likely copied from template without proper escaping
issue_1_generate_deploy.why_introduced: Python f-string or template syntax used inside bash heredoc without escaping
issue_1_generate_deploy.why_problematic: Bash interprets {{ as invalid substitution syntax, causing parse errors
issue_1_generate_deploy.fix_approach: Escape braces or use Python script directly instead of heredoc

issue_2_budget_overage.symptom: check-budget-overage.py fails with 'Missing overage_eur or overage_percentage'
issue_2_budget_overage.root_cause: Script looks for fields at root level, but budget agent outputs them in .data object
issue_2_budget_overage.root_cause_commit: Script created without checking actual budget agent output structure
issue_2_budget_overage.why_introduced: Assumed budget.json structure without verifying agent output format
issue_2_budget_overage.why_problematic: Script can't find overage fields in .data.overage and .data.overage_percentage
issue_2_budget_overage.fix_approach: Add .data object path to field lookup logic (lines 53-62)

issue_3_manual_skeleton.symptom: Manually created requirements-skeleton.json and plan-skeleton.json twice
issue_3_manual_skeleton.root_cause: No automation scripts exist for skeleton initialization
issue_3_manual_skeleton.why_problematic: Manual JSON creation is error-prone, time-consuming, and not reusable
issue_3_manual_skeleton.fix_approach: Create parameterized scripts: init-requirements-skeleton.sh (from interview) and init-plan-skeleton.sh (requirements → plan with location detection)
